transportAdvice: The historic downtown peninsula is very walkable, with most major attractions, restaurants, and shops accessible on foot; a local bus network serves the broader city but coverage for tourists is limited, so taxis and ride-hail vehicles are widely available and practical for reaching areas beyond the peninsula.

weather.description: Cool and mild by Southern standards, with occasional cold snaps and light rain but generally pleasant for sightseeing.
Still cool but early signs of spring begin to emerge, with comfortable daytime temperatures and occasional rain showers.
Spring arrives with warming temperatures and blooming gardens, making it one of the most scenic times to visit.
Warm and beautiful with azaleas in full bloom; ideal weather for walking the historic streets and visiting plantations.
Warm and increasingly humid with afternoon thunderstorms becoming more frequent; still very enjoyable for outdoor activities.
Hot and humid with regular afternoon thunderstorms; beach visits are popular but midday heat can be intense.
The hottest and most humid month, with frequent thunderstorms and the peak of hurricane season beginning; plan outdoor activities for the morning.
Remains very hot and humid with continued storm activity; hurricane awareness is important throughout this month.
Still warm and humid with the peak of hurricane season; temperatures begin to ease slightly toward the end of the month.
One of the best months to visit, with comfortable temperatures, lower humidity, and minimal rainfall.
Pleasantly cool and dry with fewer crowds, making it an excellent time for exploring the city's history and dining scene.
Cool and festive with holiday decorations throughout the historic district; occasional cold fronts can bring chilly evenings.
